titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Connecticut Miscellanea Collection
1721-1999
(Bulk 1906-1936)
MS 002 MS 002 MS 002
titlestmt.author: Lloyd Williams, Jamie Cantoni, Brian Stevens

repository.corpname: Western Connecticut State University Archives and Special Collections

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Western Connecticut State University. Archives and Special Collections Library

did.abstract: This collection contains historic printed miscellanea of Connecticut. Commercial businesses, municipal boards and commissions, and other clubs and organizations produced the material that is in this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:

Ruth A. Haas Library
Archives and Special Collections
181 White Street
Danbury, CT 06810
Phone: 203-837-8992
E-mail: stevensb@wcsu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Connecticut Miscellanea Collection; MS 002; box number; folder number; Western Connecticut State University Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains historic printed miscellanea of Connecticut. Printed miscellanea produced for regional promotional purposes may be revealing about the people and the time in which they were produced. Commercial businesses, municipal boards and commissions, and other clubs and organizations produced the material that is in this collection.

This collection is comprised of business pamphlets, programs, newspaper clippings, newsletters, and leaflets. There is also a fragment from the David Scott House in Ridgefield, CT, which is the home of the Ridgefield Historical Society.
Included in this collection are also some issues of The American Hatter (1892-1935) which were originally cataloged separately but are included in this inventory.

Included in the original inventory were NY State line to Bethel, CT. Relocation of U.S. 6 (12 sheets, 2 sets of 6) | 1955; Map of Putnam County, NY. County Superintendent of Highways | 1961; and Ridgefield, Connecticut 2 large maps | 1942-1955, however these items appear to be missing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are grouped into 4 series.

did.unittitle: Party machinery; the caucus and convention system of Connecticut, by Ruth McIntire Dadourian

odd.head: General
odd.p: Published by the Connecticut League of Women Voters. It was kept inside Mrs. William Allen of Ridgefield's copy of The Actual Government of Connecticut published by the National Woman Suffrage Publishing Co. held by WCSU Special Collections.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Papers include "Historic and Prehistoric Indians of the Connecticut Valley" by Agnes Lehning, "Indians of Western Connecticut" by Elaine Hendrickson, and "Indian Land Loss in Virginina: The Beginning of a National Pattern" by Helen C. Rountree.

did.unittitle: Native American Printed Articles and Pamphlets

odd.head: General
odd.p: Acticles and Pamphlets include: "Indians of the Sound: Part II," "Land-Use, Settlement Patterns and Subsistence Agriculture: a demographic perspective," "Guide to Mount Hope," "A Native Thanksgiving: American Indian Cooking," "The Weantinoge Site and an Archeology of Ten Centuries of Native History," "Native American Authors Distribution Project," Faces: the magazine about People "The Iroquois," "Pilgrims' Paradox: Thanksgiving in the eye of the beholder," "Loopholes in Religious Liberty: The Need for a Federal Law to Protext Freedom of Worship for NAtive People," and "New England Logboats: Four Centuries of Watercraft."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs are from the anthropology 561 summer field school at Sheep Rock that Laurie Weinstein participated in during the summer of 1967.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles include: Cpmmecticut Indians Fight; The Region as Reliquary; book review of "The Colonies in Transition 1660-1713;" Maine Municipalities in Turmoil Over Land Suit Filed by Indians; Hero Falling from Pedestal: Statue of man who led Indian massacre to be moved; 78-man Trive Fights to Keep Its Reservation; Indians Rush to Join Legal Fight for Land; Wampanoags Sow the Seeds of Native Traditions; Indians' Tactics Differ in Bid to Regain Control; New England Indians Strive to Rebuild Tribes; Indians Feel Pull of Past, Realities of Present; Wampanoag Tribe Used to Hunt and Fish All of Cape Cod. Now Their Territory is Limited to a Relatively Small Section of Mashpee; Artifact Hunters Blitz Ancient Indian Sites; Tribe Wants Casino; Flake Makes Digger's Day; The Last of the Mohegans; First Encounters: EArly Thanksgiving Celebrated Peace and Harmony Between Pilgrims and Indians, But the Good Feelings Didn't Last; Blood on Native Soil; Keeping Indian Tradition Is a Family's FAssion; Pequots are Not the Enemy; Bill to Counteract Paugussett Land Claim Passes; Mohegans await the benefits of Recognition; Task Force on Pequot's Land Plans Meets Without Pequots; Chief Tied to Misused Aid; Preserving Tradition and Dispelling Myths; Defining How a Tribe Governs its Land; Tribes closer to reclaiming History; Their Days in the Sun: Mohegans look forward to Regaining Tribal Pride; Indian Gammimg Debate Growing in Intensity; The Siwanoy's Last Stand
